intro: Guepinia nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender guepinia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits that contain seeds. Guepinia nudicaulis is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
